intro: [WRONG START] Erythranthere suksdorfii, commonly known as the Suksdorf's monkeyflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to the western United States. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bilaterally symmetrical flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky habitats and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers, which range in color from pink to purple, bloom in late spring to early summer. Erythranthe suksdorfii is often found in stream banks and moist meadows, where it thrives in partial to full sun.
